{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3465047,"name":"Eilon nave huppert","username":"The_big_Melon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/the_big_melon/{size}/236259_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-30T09:28:15.319Z","cooked":"

so we tried to offset our modules, and the magcoder just forget its position when its restarted.
so we went to YAGSLs docs and checked the Raw Absolute Encoder in the shuffle board.
YAGSL docs Absolute Encoders
they all show 360. even when you move the wheel the value stays the same.
i would love some help

It sounds like you may be using the wrong encoder type, or you have a distance issue for mag encoder readings. can you take a photo of the encoder?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2024-12-30T10:50:29.137Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":18.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":477596,"topic_slug":"mag-coder-problems-in-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/mag-coder-problems-in-yagsl/477596/3","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3465052,"name":"Eilon nave huppert","username":"The_big_Melon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/the_big_melon/{size}/236259_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-30T10:52:38.273Z","cooked":"

We are using a Mag Encoder and initially tried to retrieve the encoder position from the self-test in Phoenix Tuner. However, the offsets were incorrect. Next, we attempted to obtain the position using Shuffleboard.

image12001600 145 KB

The documentation specifies using the Raw Absolute Encoder, but since it only returns 360掳, we instead tried the Raw Angle Encoder, which initially appeared to work. However, after shutting down the robot and manually changing the wheels angle, the alignment did not persist, and each wheel pointed to a different angle.

To better explain we are trying to run yagsl with neos for steer and drive and mag coder for the abs encoder the mag is connected to a talon srx

Is this configuration supported and if so what do we need to put in the jason to use it?

Ok we will try this

Also the srx return values in 4096 ticks per revolution do we need to change the conversion factor or is there another value we need to chabge for it to work correctly?
